III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12409
Section (1) An agency’s education policy shall ensure that, within 5 school
Description days of placement, an agency shall provide for the enrollment of
each child of school age, as defined by state law, into a school
program.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was not registered for school within five days.
Investigation The Reporting Source was not interviewed for this investigation
because the telephone number or contact information was not
provided for interview.
Note: This investigation was initiated due to a companion case
involving two foster parents’ licenses with two different private
agencies and siblings placed in the homes where each agency
has full responsibility for each sibling. For more detailed
information refer to SI#2023C0000054.
The Program Director was interviewed on 11/23/2022. The
Program Director reported that her agency has full case
responsibility for Youth A who is the sibling of Youth B. Another
agency has full case responsibility for Youth B. Youth B left his
foster home over the weekend of 10/08/2022, due to an
altercation with his foster parent and moved to his sister’s foster
home. The Program Director reported this arrangement was
2

made by their agency foster parent and Youth B’s foster parent
from the other agency and without the knowledge of either agency
caseworker. She said neither foster parent followed the agencies’
policies of reporting this information to the assigned caseworkers
the weekend of 10/08/2022.
The Program Director reported she learned of this information on
Monday, 10/11/2022 from her licensing supervisor who was
informed by their foster parent that Youth A’s sibling was in her
home and refusing to return to his foster parent. She said her
agency contacted the Program Manager of Samaritas -Southeast
to discuss placement options and what had occurred over the
weekend between the foster parents and the siblings.
The Program Director reported there were several Team Decision
Meetings (TDM) held with Samaritas - Southeast and DHHS case
worker and supervisor. She reported initially her agency was not
in favor of Youth B living in the home of their foster parent and
with his sister, Youth A. She said however, their Foster Parent
reported in the TDM meeting held on 10/24/2022, that she would
be willing to keep Youth B in her home as a borrowed bed
placement. She said all parties agreed to this placement option
due to Youth B having no other placement option. She said
paperwork for a borrowed bed placement began. The Program
Director said Youth B was refusing to return to his foster parent
and that his foster parent from Samaritas - Southeast was refusing
to allow Youth B back into her home. She said she learned that
Youth B had an altercation with his foster parent, became enraged
in the home and destroyed items in his bedroom. Youth B’s foster
parent requested a 30 – day removal.
The Program Director said Samaritas - Southeast has full
responsibility of Youth B therefore, their agency did not make
arrangement for enrolling Youth B in school. She reported the
borrowed bed request was not signed until 11/03/2022. Youth B
had not attended school since the weekend of 10/08/2022.
The Program Director reported that on 11/08/2022 the foster care
worker for Youth A asked the foster care worker from Youth B’s
agency about his school enrollment and whether this was a
permanent placement for Youth B. The Program Director reported
that the caseworker from Samaritas - Southeast stated that efforts
were still being made for Youth B’s placement. She said since
Samaritas – Southeast still had full case responsibility, it was
suggested that Samaritas - Southeast enroll Youth B in school.
3

The Licensing Supervisor and Foster Care Worker reported the
same information as the Program Director. There was no
additional information to add.
Documentation reviewed:
A timeline documentation of information detailing the interaction
between both private agencies regarding Youth A and Youth B’s
placement.
Safety plans for the youth’s while being placed together provided
to the foster parent.
TDM minutes between the agencies and DHHS discussing
placement options, safety plans, and case responsibility.
Analysis The enrollment in school for Youth B is the responsibility of the
agency who has full case responsibility of Youth B. Therefore,
Youth B’s placement in a Child Safe foster home did not make
them responsible for school enrollment. That responsibility
remained with the placing agency.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
